subsection.name: General
subsection.p: The plugin installs with an example usergroup that is embargo enabled, that is, users from that group can set and remove the embargo flag. It is possible to define more groups and users, as this page describes.

subsection.name: Using the existing example group
subsection.p: The name of the existing embargo-enabled group is named 'embargo-example-group' and initially no user belongs to it. As an admin, you can add users to this group. In the following image, a user with username 'Ed' is being added to 2 groups: 'editor', so he can login and act an an editor, and 'embargo-example-group' so he can manage the embargo flag on documents. When this user sets an embargo, that embargo is specific to his usergroup. All users in the same group can see and edit this embargo, but no other group can.

subsection.name: Adding more embargo-enabled groups
